Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the small 10% on maternal deaths by stating that close to 45% of maternal deaths come from this group.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or data to support the statement that close to 45% of maternal deaths come from the small 10%.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes a direct relationship between the small 10% and maternal deaths without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to maternal deaths beyond the small 10% mentioned.
